definition: to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
open door policy/Egyptian President Sadat's infitah policy towards investment and relations with Israel
see 開放源碼|开放源码[kai1 fang4 yuan2 ma3]

pinyin: kai1 fang4 yuan2 ma3 ruan3 jian4
kai1 fang4 xi4 tong3 hu4 lian2

sentences.english: But just 9 percent of those who use M.I.T. OpenCourseWare are educators.
sentences.chinese: 但是只有9%使用麻省理工开放课程的网友是教育者。

sentences.english: In opening wider to the outside world, we must pay great attention to safeguarding our national economic security.
sentences.chinese: 在扩大对外开放中，要十分注意维护国家经济安全。
磁选机采用开放型磁系。

sentences.english: The hitherto unutilized amount of the property value is opened for use.
sentences.chinese: 迄今未动用余额的财产价值是开放供使用。

sentences.english: At West Ham he was thought of as the rosebud that never properly flowered.
sentences.chinese: 在西汉姆他被认为是一个尚未开放的花蕾。

sentences.english: I was pleasantly surprised to find several well-established open source initiatives.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴地发现了几个出色的开放源码项目。

sentences.english: The therapy programs in the double-blinded trial and open-label trail are the same.
sentences.chinese: 开放试验和双盲试验遵循同一研究方案。

sentences.english: Be open to new ideas, new ways of seeing things and new styles.
sentences.chinese: 要开放地接纳新观点，看事物的新角度，新风格。

sentences.english: The adult likes to lay eggs in the exocuticle of the receptacle.
sentences.chinese: 成虫喜产卵于巳开放之花朵的花托外表皮内。

sentences.english: Only by being open and inclusive can a country prosper and can our continent prosper.
sentences.chinese: 只有开放兼容，国家才能富强，亚欧大陆才能兴旺。

sentences.english: Especially since the game is ten times as customisable.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是在辐射三的开放性还要大十倍的情况下。

sentences.english: All you need is an open mind and an hour each day.
sentences.chinese: 你所需要的只是一个开放的头脑和每天一小时的时间。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the curative effects of laparoscope operation and spermatic veins operation in patients with spermophlebectasia.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察腹腔镜与开放手术治疗精索脉曲张的疗效。

sentences.english: It has landscaped grounds have an open and quiet ambience.
sentences.chinese: 它具有开放的花木场宁静氛围。

sentences.english: As usual, the code will be released under an open source license.
sentences.chinese: 照常，代码将遵循开放源码许可证发布。

sentences.english: Indeed the Open Platform is now one of the hottest topics in China.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，开放式平台是中国的热点话题之一。

definition: to open up (windows for air, ideas for discussion, transportation routes etc)
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
(of systems, facilities etc) comprehensive/well-developed/excellent/to refine/to improve
to face/to turn towards/to incline to/geared towards/catering for/-oriented/facial feature/appearance/aspect/facet
to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to draw into/to pull into/to introduce
to access (a network)/to insert (a plug) into (a socket)
